com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.application

Class StaticApplicationTopology

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.application.StaticApplicationTopology
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IApplicationTopology

    public class StaticApplicationTopology
extends java.lang.Object
implements IApplicationTopology
    Provides support for mesh, tree, and chain topologies via a file specification. Format of file is as follows: 
     
 // specifies a list of nodes connected in clock-wise order.
 chain: <list of node instances>
 
 // Specifies a single parent and a list of child nodes.
 parent-child: < parent node instance > <list of node instances as children>
 
 // specifies a list of fully connected nodes. 
 neighbors: <list of node instances>
    Author:
    dawood

      • getApplicationPeers

        public java.util.Collection<IApplicationDescriptor> getApplicationPeers(IApplicationDescriptor app,
                                                               TopologyRelationship topo,
                                                               IPhysicalTopology physTopo)
        Description copied from interface: IApplicationTopology
        Get all the application peers that have the given topological relationship with the given node.
        Specified by:
        getApplicationPeers in interface IApplicationTopology
        Parameters:
        app - the application peer for which the peers with the given relationship are to be determined.
        topo - the topological relationship of the returned applications, relative to the one given.
        Returns:
        never null.

      • getRelationships

        public java.util.Collection<TopologyRelationship> getRelationships(IApplicationDescriptor wrt,
                                                          IApplicationDescriptor to,
                                                          IPhysicalTopology physTopo)
        Description copied from interface: IApplicationTopology
        Get the topological relationship of one node relative to another. If the node is reachable, the list will always contain TopologicalRelationship.Reachable, but may contain others. If there is no connectivity then an empty collection is returned.
        Specified by:
        getRelationships in interface IApplicationTopology
        Parameters:
        wrt - the application peer for which the relationship(s) to the to node are desired. If wrt is a child of to then TopologicalRelationship.Child is returned in the list.
        to - the application peer for which its relationship with from is desired. If to is a child of wrt then TopologicalRelationship.Parent is returned in the list.
        Returns:
        never null.
